q: pieces including a statue of King Tutankhamun have been stolen from the Egyptian museum in Cairo's Tahrir Square, Egypt's minister of state for antiquities Zahi Hawass said on Sunday. The objects stolen by looters include a gilded wood statue of the 18th Dynasty king Tutankhamun being carried by a goddess and parts of`` a gilded wood statue of Tutankhamun harpooning,'' a statement on Zahi Hawass ' website read. For 18 days Tahrir Square was the epicenter of the nationwide protests demanding the resignation of President

Eric Schmidt drew fire for responding to a hypothetical question posed at a forum in Washington, DC, about an implant that would let Google Inc. know what its users were thinking. He responded that Google Inc. 's policy is to get right up to the creepy line and not cross it , and an implant would cross the line. He also said that as users voluntarily share information online, it doesn't need users to type in search queries for the company to tailor the results.

her`` brand'' with fans. England footballer Ashley, Cheryl Cole , 27, had continued to travel and book hotels under her maiden name. Last night a source close to the X Factor host said: Cheryl Cole considered going back to her maiden name but now she has dismissed the idea. People knew who she was as a Cheryl Cole but she has only become truly famous as Cheryl Cole . yet but seeds have been sown by people like Black Eyed Peas singer Will.i.am and it is important she creates a lasting brand. It would be madness to change back. The Sunday Mirror can also confirm that Simon Cowell has promised her a job as a judge on the US X Factor. He has spent the past few days convincing American producers that she will be a huge success.
